key.name: first-start
key.description: If it's the first start of the application.

key.name: max-concurrent-downloads
key.description: Set maximum number of parallel downloads for every static (HTTP/FTP) URI, torrent and metalink. Default: 5

key.name: max-connection-per-server
key.description: The maximum number of connections to one server for each download. Default: 1

key.name: max-overall-download-limit
key.description: Set max overall download speed in bytes/sec. You can append K or M(1K = 1024, 1M = 1024K). 0 means unrestricted. Default: 0

key.name: max-overall-upload-limit
key.description: Set max overall upload speed in bytes/sec. You can append K or M(1K = 1024, 1M = 1024K). 0 means unrestricted. Default: 0

key.name: all-proxy
key.description: Use this proxy server for all protocols. To erase previously defined proxy, use "". You can override this setting and specify a proxy server for a particular protocol using http-proxy, https-proxy and ftp-proxy options. This affects all URIs. The format of PROXY is [http://][USER:PASSWORD@]HOST[:PORT].

key.name: http-proxy
key.description: Use this proxy server for HTTP. To erase previously defined proxy, use "". This affects all URIs. The format of PROXY is [http://][USER:PASSWORD@]HOST[:PORT]

key.name: https-proxy
key.description: Use this proxy server for HTTPS. To erase previously defined proxy, use "". This affects all URIs. The format of PROXY is [http://][USER:PASSWORD@]HOST[:PORT]

key.name: ftp-proxy
key.description: Use this proxy server for FTP. To erase previously defined proxy, use "". This affects all URIs. The format of PROXY is [http://][USER:PASSWORD@]HOST[:PORT]

key.name: connect-timeout
key.description: Set the connect timeout in seconds to establish connection to HTTP/FTP/proxy server. After the connection is established, this option makes no effect and timeout option is used instead. Default: 60

key.name: timeout
key.description: Set timeout in seconds. Default: 60

key.name: max-file-not-found
key.description: If aria2 receives ‘file not found’ status from the remote HTTP/FTP servers NUM times without getting a single byte, then force the download to fail. Specify 0 to disable this option. This options is effective only when using HTTP/FTP servers. Default: 0

key.name: split
key.description: Download a file using N connections. If more than N URIs are given, first N URIs are used and remaining URIs are used for backup. If less than N URIs are given, those URIs are used more than once so that N connections total are made simultaneously. The number of connections to the same host is restricted by max-connection-per-server option. Please see min-split-size option too. Please note that in Metalink download, this option has no effect and use -C option instead. Default: 5

key.name: min-split-size
key.description: aria2 does not split less than 2*SIZE byte range. For example, let’s consider downloading 20MiB file. If SIZE is 10M, aria2 can split file into 2 range [0-10MiB) and [10MiB-20MiB) and download it using 2 sources(if split >= 2, of course). If SIZE is 15M, since 2*15M > 20MiB, aria2 does not split file and download it using 1 source. You can append K or M(1K = 1024, 1M = 1024K). Possible Values: 1M-1024M Default: 20M]]

key.name: auto-file-renaming
key.description: Rename file name if the same file already exists. This option works only in HTTP(S)/FTP download. The new file name has a dot and a number(1..9999) appended. Default: true

key.name: follow-torrent
key.description: If true is specified, when a file whose suffix is ".torrent" or content type is "application/x-bittorrent" is downloaded, aria2 parses it as a torrent file and downloads files mentioned in it. If false is specified, the action mentioned above is not taken. Default: true

key.name: follow-metalink
key.description: If true is specified, when a file whose suffix is ".meta4" or ".metalink" or content type of "application/metalink4+xml" or "application/metalink+xml" is downloaded, aria2 parses it as a metalink file and downloads files mentioned in it. If false is specified, the action mentioned above is not taken. Default: true

key.name: seed-time
key.description: Specify seeding time in minutes. Also see the seed-ratio option. Specifying seed-time=0 disables seeding after download completed. Default: 120

key.name: seed-ratio
key.description: Specify share ratio. Seed completed torrents until share ratio reaches RATIO. You are strongly encouraged to specify equals or more than 1.0 here. Specify 0.0 if you intend to do seeding regardless of share ratio. If --seed-time option is specified along with this option, seeding ends when at least one of the conditions is satisfied. Default: 1.0

key.name: bt-max-open-files
key.description: Specify maximum number of files to open in each BitTorrent download. Default: 100

key.name: bt-max-peers
key.description: Specify the maximum number of peers per torrent. 0 means unlimited. Default: 55

key.name: bt-tracker-connect-timeout
key.description: Set the connect timeout in seconds to establish connection to tracker. After the connection is established, this option makes no effect and bt-tracker-timeout option is used instead. Default: 60

key.name: bt-tracker-timeout
key.description: Set timeout in seconds. Default: 60

key.name: bt-prioritize-piece
key.description: Try to download first and last pieces of each file first. This is useful for previewing files. The argument can contain 2 keywords: head and tail. To include both keywords, they must be separated by comma. These keywords can take one parameter, SIZE. For example, if head=SIZE is specified, pieces in the range of first SIZE bytes of each file get higher priority. tail=SIZE means the range of last SIZE bytes of each file. SIZE can include K or M(1K = 1024, 1M = 1024K). If SIZE is omitted, SIZE=1M is used.

key.name: bt-prioritize
key.description: Enable BT prioritize, wrapper of 'bt-prioritize-piece' for conveniece.

key.name: metalink-servers
key.description: The number of servers to connect to simultaneously. Some Metalinks regulate the number of servers to connect. aria2 strictly respects them. This means that if Metalink defines the maxconnections attribute lower than NUM_SERVERS, then aria2 uses the value of maxconnections attribute instead of NUM_SERVERS. See also -s and -j options. Default: 5

key.name: metalink-language
key.description: The language of the file to download.

key.name: metalink-location
key.description: The location of the preferred server. A comma-delimited list of locations is acceptable, for example, jp,us.

key.name: metalink-os
key.description: The operating system of the file to download.

key.name: metalink-version
key.description: The version of the file to download.

key.name: http-user
key.description: Set HTTP user. This affects all URIs.

key.name: http-passwd
key.description: Set HTTP password. This affects all URIs.

key.name: ftp-user
key.description: Set FTP user. This affects all URIs. Default: anonymous

key.name: ftp-passwd
key.description: Set FTP password. This affects all URIs. If user name is embedded but password is missing in URI, aria2 tries to resolve password using .netrc. If password is found in .netrc, then use it as password. If not, use the password specified in this option. Default: YanerUser@

key.name: referer
key.description: Set Referer. This affects all URIs.
